caption_original:
For nearly 40 years Zeballos‚Äô 100 residents relied on ‚ÄúThe Old Red‚Äù (aka. Sugarloaf Bridge) to cross from one side of their Village to the other.
But only vehicles weighing less than 3,000 kg could use the bridge; requiring 10-minute detours for emergency services and residents with heavier vehicles.
Thanks to a $2.9 million grant from the federal Gas Tax Fund, replacing the bridge with something more practical went from dream to reality.
Last month the entire community came out to celebrate the opening of the new Sugarloaf Bridge.
And what better way to welcome the new structure than by parading a fleet of heavy-weight vehicles across for the first time!
Congrats, Zeballos! We hope the ‚ÄúThe New Red‚Äù serves you well for years to come.
caption_cleaned: For nearly years Zeballos‚Äô residents relied on ‚ÄúThe Old Red‚Äù (aka. Sugarloaf Bridge) to cross from one side of their Village to the other. But only vehicles weighing less than ,000 kg could use the bridge; requiring -minute detours for emergency services and residents with heavier vehicles. Thanks to a $2.9 million grant from the federal Gas Tax Fund, replacing the bridge with something more practical went from dream to reality. Last month the entire community came out to celebrate the opening of the new Sugarloaf Bridge. And what better way to welcome the new structure than by parading a fleet of heavy-weight vehicles across for the first time! Congrats, Zeballos! We hope the ‚ÄúThe New Red‚Äù serves you well for years to come.

caption_original:
A smart cities approach aims to achieve meaningful outcomes for residents through data and connected technology.
Why? Because data and connected technology enable: 
‚Ä¢ Openness
When communities make their data truly accessible, usable and barrier-free, their decision-making processes become transparent, empowering citizens and strengthening the relationship between residents and public organizations.
‚Ä¢ Integration
Data and connected technology empower communities to break down silos that exist within local governments and public organizations. 
‚Ä¢ Transferability
When tools and technological approaches are open-source, transparent and standardized, they can be used by communities across the country, no matter their size or capacity. 
‚Ä¢ Collaboration
Connected technology enables communities to bring traditional and non-traditional partners together to collaborate.
caption_cleaned: A smart cities approach aims to achieve meaningful outcomes for residents through data and connected technology. Why? Because data and connected technology enable: ‚Ä¢ Openness When communities make their data truly accessible, usable and barrier-free, their decision-making processes become transparent, empowering citizens and strengthening the relationship between residents and public organizations. ‚Ä¢ Integration Data and connected technology empower communities to break down silos that exist within local governments and public organizations. ‚Ä¢ Transferability When tools and technological approaches are open-source, transparent and standardized, they can be used by communities across the country, no matter their size or capacity. ‚Ä¢ Collaboration Connected technology enables communities to bring traditional and non-traditional partners together to collaborate.
